perturbation.original_text: The Billing Party may deduct and withhold from any payments due to the other party under this Agreement any and all taxes and other amounts as required 6 7 under the laws of any jurisdiction that has the authority to tax the Billing Party, the other party or the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. However, should the Billing Party consider withholding payment or paying any such amount from payments due under this Agreement, the Billing Party shall send in advance to the other party a certificate setting forth the regulatory and/or legal framework for such a payment, including the provisions of the international tax treaty allowing such payment. The other party will have 30 days from the reception of such information to accept or refuse such payment/withholding:
perturbation.changed_text: The Billing Party may deduct and withhold from any payments due to the other party under this Agreement any and all taxes and other amounts as deemed necessary by the Billing Party. However, should the Billing Party consider withholding payment or paying any such amount from payments due under this Agreement, the Billing Party may notify the other party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause outlines a process where tax withholdings are justified with proper documentation and a 30-day window for the other party to contest it. The modified clause removes the requirements for regulatory justification and the 30-day acceptance window. By omitting these consumer rights the contract introduce legal risk. This violates tax regulations that require proper withholding documentation and processes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Tax regulations requiring proper documentation and processes for withholding payments

perturbation.original_text: The Billing Party shall, for two years following each transaction relating to the Co-Branded Service, keep true and accurate records and books of account of such transaction containing all particulars which may be necessary for the purpose of auditing payments to the Non-Billing Party under this Agreement. During such two-year period, and upon reasonable notice to the Billing Party, the Non-Billing Party shall have the right to have an audit conducted through a licensed independent accounting firm, of any billings, collections, and taxes on such itemized statement, and to examine the records and books of account of the Billing Party in connection therewith. The Billing Party will bear the costs of such audit if a discrepancy Source: RAND WORLDWIDE INC, 8-K/A, 4/2/2001 or error of computation in an amount greater than $10,000 in favor of the Non-Billing Party is identified.
perturbation.changed_text: The Billing Party shall keep records of transactions related to the Co-Branded Service. The Non-Billing Party may request to examine these records.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'true and accurate' and deleting the details about the auditing process (2 year retention, independent firm, who bears cost of audit) the contract makes it hard for Non-Billing Party to verify financial reports, violating accounting laws that require verifiable records and audit trails. Deleting that Billing party will bare the cost of such audit if a discrepancy or error of computation in an amount greater than $10,000 in favor of the Non-Billing Party is identified introduce the legal risks.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting laws regarding verifiable records and audit trails

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of New York, applicable to contracts executed in and to be performed entirely within that Source: RAND WORLDWIDE INC, 8-K/A, 4/2/2001 state. This Agreement shall not be governed by the U.N. Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. The parties hereto hereby (a) submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of any court of competent jurisdiction sitting in the State of Delaware, The City of Wilmington for the purpose of any Action arising out of or relating to this Agreement brought by any party hereto, and (b) agree, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, to waive, and not to assert by way of motion, defense, or otherwise, in any such Action, any claim that is not subject personally to the jurisdiction of the above-named courts, that its property is exempt or immune from attachment or execution, that the Action is brought in an inconvenient forum, that the venue of the Action is improper, or that this Agreement may not be enforced in or by any of the above-named courts.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of New York. The parties hereby submit to the jurisdiction of any court for the purpose of any Action arising out of or relating to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the clause 'applicable to contracts executed in and to be performed entirely within that state' and the explicit waiver of claims regarding jurisdiction and venue. This potentially opens the door for disputes about jurisdiction and venue, particularly if one party is located outside of New York or Delaware, increasing the legal risks. This could also violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which exists in every contract under New York law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under New York law.
